title: Pickled Vegetables
introduction: Pickled vegetables are a delightful accompaniment to antipasti, cold meats, or sandwiches. These colorful, tangy veggies can be varied according to seasonality or personal preference. With options like button mushrooms, green beans, small turnips, radishes, and cucumbers, you're sure to find a combination that's to your taste. They make for fantastic gifts when packed in a pretty jar.
ingredients: 3 medium carrots, quartered lengthwise and cut into 1½-inch lengths
2 tender celery ribs, halved lengthwise and cut into 1½-inch lengths
1 red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch squares
instructions: In a large saucepan, bring the vinegar and water to a boil. Add the sugar, salt, and bay leaf and cook, stirring, until the sugar and salt are dissolved, about 1 minute.
Add the vegetables and bring the liquid back to boiling. Cook until the vegetables are tender yet still crisp, about 5 minutes. Drain the vegetables, reserving the liquid.
Divide the vegetables between two sterilized pint jars. Add the vinegar mixture. Let cool, then cover and refrigerate 24 hours before using. These keep well for at least 2 weeks in the refrigerator.
